answerText: Cathedral[10] Cathedral was written by this minimalist American poet and short story writer. He also wrote the short story collections Will You Please be Quiet, Please? and What We Talk About When We Talk About Love.
heading: VCU Closed  |2013 | Delaware + Michigan A  | 9 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This story's narrator notes that his wife is "always trying to write a poem." For 10 points each: [10] Name this short story, in which the narrator, who is initially unhappy that a blind man is coming to visit him and his wife, ends up smoking a doobie with the blind man before watching a TV show about the title structure.
